creator: kdowney@amberarcher.com
text:
The JCEMapper code just returns null when it can't find an algorithm; this
should probably be an exceptional condition instead so it doesn't just bomb with
an NPE. Assertion checks to see if JCEMapper has been initialized before use
would be helpful for debugging as well. That would cover the two cases where
this happens: alogrithms not present or Init.init() not called before a decrypt
or encrypt.

It might be better to sprinkle the critical entry point classes (like XMLCipher)
with static blocks calling Init.init() to ensure it's called.
The JCEMapper(in the 1.2 version) is not meant to be public.
creator: raul-info@r-bg.com
